alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Hall; Hamilton; Merrick; Nuckolls; Polk; Thayer; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 14 at 4:01PM CST until December 15 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Dangerous Fire Weather Conditions Expected Wednesday... .A vigorous low pressure system will generate very strong winds across the local area Wednesday. These strong winds...combined with low relative humidity values...will result in potentially dangerous fire weather conditions across the local area. In addition to the strong winds...a change in wind direction with the associated cold front could make controlling any fire that develops difficult. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 005, 006, 007, 017, 018, 019, 048, 049, 062, 063, 064, 075, 076, 077, 084, 085, 086 AND 087... * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 005 Phillips, Fire Weather Zone 006 Smith, Fire Weather Zone 007 Jewell, Fire Weather Zone 017 Rooks, Fire Weather Zone 018 Osborne and Fire Weather Zone 019 Mitchell. In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 048 Merrick, Fire Weather Zone 049 Polk, Fire Weather Zone 062 Hall, Fire Weather Zone 063 Hamilton, Fire Weather Zone 064 York, Fire Weather Zone 075 Adams, Fire Weather Zone 076 Clay, Fire Weather Zone 077 Fillmore, Fire Weather Zone 084 Franklin, Fire Weather Zone 085 Webster, Fire Weather Zone 086 Nuckolls and Fire Weather Zone 087 Thayer. * WINDS...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. Winds will turn to the west and then northwest during the afternoon and early evening. * TIMING...Noon Wednesday through 9 PM Wednesday * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could lead to fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Hall; Hamilton; Merrick; Nuckolls; Polk; Thayer; Webster; York
